title.narrative: Peace and Stabilisation Programme Horn of Africa 2018-2022

description.narrative: Denmark's Peace and Stabilisation Programme for the Horn of Africa 2018-2022 covers Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia with a special focus on the ongoing conflict in Somalia, recognizing its regional consequences.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: All sectors of society at the local communities, national and the regional levels have a strong, well-coordinated collective capacity to reject and resist violent extremist ideologies to minimize the number of individuals whom terrorists can radicalize and recruit to violence.
In 2022, the number of terrorist attack incidents is reduced by 24% compared to the 2018 baseline number of attacks.
Output 2.2: ICEPCVE to enable target groups to effectively apply best practices, including gender and conflict-sensitive tools and methodologies, in their preventative work and strategies.
The ICEPCVE convene 6 learning visits for state representatives with 15 participants per learning visit.

target.value: The ICEPCVE has convened 2 learning visits for state representatives with 15 participants per learning visit of which at least 50 percent are female.
The ICEPCVE has convened 1 learning visit for state representatives with 15 participants of which at least 50 percent are female.
The ICEPCVE has convened 1 learning visit for state representatives with 15 participants of which at least 50 percent are female.

actual.value: No learning visits for state representatives reported.

target.value: The ICEPCVE has convened 2 learning visits for state representatives with 15 participants per learning visit of which at least 50 percent are female.

actual.value: No learning visits for state representatives reported.

title.narrative: Output 1.2: ICEPCVE to enable target groups to implement initiatives aligned with the IGAD Regional P/CVE Strategy. The ICEPCVE provides trusted platforms and resources for the direct target groups to engage with one another and for them to have their recommendations validated with policymakers.
The ICEPCVE convenes bi-annual workshops on P/CVE collaboration between state and non-state actors.

target.value: The ICEPCVE has convened 2 bi-annual workshops on P/CVE collaboration between state and non-state actors.
The ICEPCVE has convened 1 bi-annual workshop on P/CVE collaboration between state and non-state actors.
The ICEPCVE has convened 1 bi-annual workshop on P/CVE collaboration between state and non-state actors.

actual.value: No workshop reported. However, a meeting for CSOs was held to 1)discuss how to strengthen the regional CSO network in the region, and 2) equip CSO leader with communication skills to produce alternative and counter narratives against violent extremism.

target.value: The ICEPCVE has convened 2 bi-annual workshops on P/CVE collaboration between state and non-state actors.

actual.value: The center started planning a strategic communication workshop targeting youth.

title.narrative: Output 1.1: ICEPCVE to enable target groups to implement initiatives aligned with the IGAD Regional P/CVE Strategy. The CSO Hub and the regional researcher’s network will coordinate implementation of initiatives by non-state actors.
The CSO Network, the Youth Network, and the Women’s Organisation Network are active and increase their number of enrolled members with 158 in total per year.

target.value: The CSO Network, the Youth Network, and the Women’s Organisation Network have 158 enrolled members in total.

actual.value: 40 new members from 5 different organisations per country. The center has focused on increasing network membership for youth and CSOs from all countries - mainly through virtual platforms.The center launched a virtual platform where non-state actors can communicate and share experiences, the center hosted a regional media roundtable discussion on establishing a regional media network, the center mapped youth organisations in Sudan and South Sudan, the the center mapped 30 women-led organisations dealing with P/CVE and added them to the digitial hub.

target.value: The CSO Network, the Youth Network, and the Women’s Organisation Network have 158 enrolled members in total.
The CSO Network, the Youth Network, and the Women’s Organisation Network have 158 enrolled members in total.
The CSO Network, the Youth Network, and the Women’s Organisation Network have 158 enrolled members in total.

actual.value: Number of members not reported. Women's network not mentioned. Youth and CSO networks established in Djibouti, Ethiopia, Kenya, Somalia, Tanzania and Uganda.
